page.title: 18BRANSTON'S LANDSCAPE
page.content: Branston is fairly low lying. To the west the land rises to about 60m above sea level because most of the land towards the east descends to 24m above sea level because most of the land towards the East is very low and used to marshy fen land. Drainage has made it into good farmland. In Branston itself there are a lot of residential buildings but further out most of the buildings are for farming purposes. Most of the land is wide open fields and used for growing crops like wheat and barley. There are not many trees and there are no forests, rivers or big streams. The average rainfall per month is 50mm. Temperatures range from an average of 3 degrees c. in January to 20 degrees c. in June, July and August. June is usually the sunniest month.
